subject: Re: FW: favicon
preview: Excellent, I'll let Brand Chemistry know.    Thank you!     Kindest Regards,    Sarah-Jane Lamont  Client Relations Executive Assistant    T 1300 11 22 32  M 0421 478 501  E sarah-jane.lamont@axiomwor

full_threads.body:
Excellent, I'll let Brand Chemistry know.



Thank you!




Kindest Regards,



Sarah-Jane Lamont

Client Relations Executive Assistant



T 1300 11 22 32

M 0421 478 501

E sarah-jane.lamont@axiomworkplaces.com.au



http://axiomworkplaces.com.au/

If this email consists of direct marketing material and you would prefer to be removed from the mailing list, please reply to this email with the word "Unsubscribe" as the Subject.

Hi Sarah-Jane, 

Yes it was all lived before we left last night : )

There is just quirk we are working on (the first blog post appears to be duplicating), but it's fine for the Brand Chemistry team to jump in and optimise. We are creating a fix for blog post issue today. 

When you are ready to upgrade to a Pro Plan, you can head to our FAQ's page: https://wpperk.com/faqs/ The second question has a 2min video showing how best to upgrade. 

I'll be in touch.

Hi Heath,



Thank you for everything yesterday. I saw last night that the website was up and running with the blog pages fixed in addition to the team pages etc.



Brand chemistry are wanting to optimize some of our blog posts today but will not do this if there is a chance the site might be being worked on in staging - as none of their changes will be saved - so I just wanted to check if they are good to go now to work on the site?




Kindest Regards,



Sarah-Jane Lamont

Client Relations Executive Assistant



T 1300 11 22 32

M 0421 478 501

E sarah-jane.lamont@axiomworkplaces.com.au



http://axiomworkplaces.com.au/









This e-mail may contain confidential and/or privileged information. If you are not the intended recipient (or have received this e-mail in error) please notify the sender immediately and destroy this e-mail. Any unauthorised copying, disclosure or distribution of the material in this e-mail is strictly forbidden. Axiom respects your privacy and is bound by the Australian Privacy Principles. If this email consists of direct marketing material and you would prefer to be removed from the mailing list, please reply to this email with the word "Unsubscribe" as the Subject.

Hi Sarah-Jane, 

Ok here is a link to the staging site: https://staging-axiom.kinsta.cloud/our-story/

I will give you a call shortly.

Hi Heath,



Thank you, that is much appreciated. If you could let me know once all sorted that would be great so I can pass on to my boss.



He has also asked me, moving forward, how will we be alerted to these issues in the future? Given this other digital marketer have him the heads up there was a problem, how can we ensure that we see these sorts of issues first? I spoke to Brand chemistry and understandably they stated it is unrealistic that they would be looking at every page of our website daily to ensure there are no issues.



I suggested that perhaps I could be notified or have an alert sent every time there is an automatic update so I could go through and check every page? Would this be possible?




Kindest Regards,



Sarah-Jane Lamont

Client Relations Executive Assistant



T 1300 11 22 32

M 0421 478 501

E sarah-jane.lamont@axiomworkplaces.com.au



http://axiomworkplaces.com.au/

Hi Sarah-Jane, 

Just an update. We updated the theme and largely have it working. We are now fixing a few errors that are occurring as it was a significant update that was required. 

We should have it sorted out before COB today.

Hi Heath,



Much appreciated, I look forward to speaking with someone around 9 as I have already dealt with this once before I might have further background for your team.




Kindest Regards,



Sarah-Jane Lamont

Client Relations Executive Assistant



T 1300 11 22 32

M 0421 478 501

E sarah-jane.lamont@axiomworkplaces.com.au



http://axiomworkplaces.com.au/

@joel Hi! I'm looking at this one too. Just an FYI I am restoring a backup from Sunday onto the staging server. I will see if this is affected. If it's ok, we will have a point of reference which may help us.

Morning Sarah, 

We will look into this as a priority this morning. I will be at my desk closer to 9, but the team are working on it in the meantime. 

I’ll keep you updated.

Hi Heath,

Unfortunately another problem has arisen with the website which needs to be fixed asap. I don't know when this has occurred but a page on the website now leads to broken links. Eg. from https://axiomworkplaces.com.au/our-story/ if you click on any of the photos, you get redirected to your 404 https://axiomworkplaces.com.au/thegem_team_person/alister-hales/ .
It also appears to read "Read more" whereas it didn't say this before, it listed their name and title and "Contact us" so if you clicked on it a pop up would appear fit the viewer to email them a message.

This happened before when the website was updated to the latest version of WordPress and the latest PHP and pretty much was the reason I left WP Engine because they couldn't figure out why it had stuffed up the Our Team pages. Their only solution was to roll back the version of WordPress, which they did and then within days I transferred to WP Perk

My boss has contacted me at 6am regarding this after it was pointed out to him by a competing digital marketing agency that it would be having a negative affect on our SEO so it needs to be fixed asap. Can you call me as soon as you start work this morning so we can try and figure out what has occurred to cause the glitch?

If you have done any updates we may need to roll back again until we figure out why this is happening.

Kindest regards
Sarah-Jane

Hi Sarah, 

Ok sure, you should be able to see the favicon now after you refresh. 

Let me know how it goes?

action.text: Joel Maligalig assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body: @joel can you please tackle this one. Thanks

Hi Heath,

Germaine from Brand chemistry sent the below email noting the Axiom website no longer has the favicon at the top left of the browser like it used to before – could you please fix this?

Kindest Regards,

Sarah-Jane Lamont
Client Relations Executive Assistant

T 1300 11 22 32 <tel:1300%2011%2022%2032>
M 0421 478 501 <tel:0421%20478%20501>
E sarah-jane.lamont@axiomworkplaces.com.au <mailto:sarah-jane.lamont@axiomworkplaces.com.au>

From: Germaine Hendrik <germaine@brandchemistry.com.au <mailto:germaine@brandchemistry.com.au>>
Sent: Friday, 15 February 2019 11:30 AM
To: Sarah-Jane Lamont <Sarah-Jane.Lamont@axiomworkplaces.com.au <mailto:Sarah-Jane.Lamont@axiomworkplaces.com.au>>
Subject: favicon

Hey Sarah-Jane,

I hope you're having a nice Friday!

Small thing, but I noticed that the Axiom website no longer has the favicon at the top left of the browser like it used to before.

To show you what I mean, I saved both the Axiom website as well as another one of my client's websites on the Bookmarks Bar on my browser. You can see from the below that the Yieldbroker website has their branding icon next to it, while the Axiom one just shows a Google logo (previously it was the circular Axiom logo)



This is not a big deal, but I just wondered if this was because of something Heath/WP Engine did when they were working on the website. Favicons contribute to branding awareness as people associate those little icons with the brand so thought you might want to look into it.

It should be a really easy fix and should take no time at all if Heath can help you sort this out.

thanks
Best,

Germaine Hendrik
Senior Consultant
0401 378 323 <tel:0401%20378%20323>
Brand chemistry
